message_1: Suppose that we have a message with a length of 1000 bits that we want to hash using SHA256 algorithm. What is the expected length of the resulting hash output in bits?
message_2: The SHA256 algorithm produces a fixed-length hash output of 256 bits, regardless of the input message size. So, the expected length of the resulting hash output for a 1000-bit message would be 256 bits.
